region.help: The region name

cloud.help:
The cloud. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE]

describe-insights.help: Describes insights for an instance in specific region for a specific tenant

instance-id.help: The IDs of the instances

availability-zone.help: The availability zone name (required for Google)

resource-group.help: The resource group name (required for Azure)

describe-resources.help: Describes resources existing in a specific region for a specific tenant

group.help:
Filter for instances by insights group. Default value: ALL.
Allowed values: ['ALL', 'UNTAGGED']

tag.help: The tag to be used as a filter: test1key:test1value. Would not have an effect if 'group' parameter specified as 'UNTAGGED'

describe-instances.help: Describes instances existing in a specific region for a specific tenant

group.help:
Filter for instances by insights group. 
Allowed values if 'insights' flag applied: ['ALL', 'INSTANCE_COSTS', 'SCHEDULES', 'TAGS', 'LIFE_TIME', 'OWNERSHIP', 'VULNERABLE']. 
Allowed values if 'insights' flag NOT applied ['ALL', 'UNTAGGED`]

risk-factor.help: Filter for instances by specific risk factor. Note: could be applied only with 'insights' flag

instance-id.help:
The IDs of the instances. 
For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002).
Required for Azure cloud

owner.help: Owner name. Allows get all instances by owner

running.help: A flag. Show only running instances

stopped.help: A flag. Show only stopped instances

resource-tag.help: The tag to be used as a filter: test1key:test1value

publish-platform-service.help: Publishes a new service based on the specified template to the catalog

delivery-method.help: An identifier who provide this service. Maestro by default

operating-system.help: The name of the Operating System

category.help:
The categories names 
Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

summary-description.help: The summary description of the service

discoverable-url.help: The URL where service description can be found

tenant.help: The tenant display name. Specifies which tenant the template belongs to

cloud.help: The cloud name. Specifies which cloud the template belongs to. Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE]

supported-cloud.help: The list of the cloud providers that support this service. It is a description for UI. Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

provider-version.help: The version of the provider. The version of provider used in the template should be indicated with the letter 'v'. For example v0.14.9

validation.regex_error: The length of the provider version should be between 2 and 17 symbols and consist of no more than 4 groups separated by (.) The following characters are required in the provider version name: v, ., 0-9. Example: v0.14.9

icon-path.help: Path to the service icon file. The image extension should be .png. The size of the image should be: width<=190px, height<=130px

validation.regex_error: Icon file name must be 1-32 characters long and can include only these characters in lower case: 'a-z', '0-9', .-_

all-tenants.help: Register service for all tenants of the customer

delete-platform-service.help: Deletes the specified service from the catalog

describe-service-section.help: Describes the section content of the certain published service

section.help: The section name. Allowed values: [USAGE, SUPPORT]

delete-service-section.help: Deletes the section content of the certain published service

section.help: The section name. Allowed values: [USAGE, SUPPORT]

block-title.help: The title of the block which will be deleted

delete-all.help: A flag. Deletes all blocks in a section

delete-empty.help: A flag. Deletes all text in section without titles

add-service-section.help: Adds usage/support section to the certain published service

section.help: The section name. Allowed values: [USAGE, SUPPORT]

block-value.help: The value of the block Usage or Support

block-value-path.help: The path to the file with a value of the block Usage or Support

update-platform-service.help: Updates specified elements of the platform service

operating-system.help: The name of the Operating System

category.help:
The categories names 
Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

template-type.help: The type of template that will be used for registering service. Allowed values: [TERRAFORM]

summary-description.help: The summary description of the service

discoverable-url.help: The URL where service description can be found

supported-cloud.help:
The list of the cloud names. Should be specified if you need 
Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

provider-version.help: The version of the provider. The version of provider used in the template should be indicated with the letter 'v'. For example v0.14.9

validation.regex_error: The length of the provider version should be between 2 and 17 symbols and consist of no more than 4 groups separated by (.) The following characters are required in the provider version name: v, ., 0-9. Example: v0.14.9

icon-path.help: Path to the service icon file. The image extension should be .png. The size of the image should be: width<=190px, height<=130px

validation.regex_error: Icon file name must be 1-32 characters long and can include only these characters in lower case: 'a-z', '0-9', .-_

support-proxy.help: A flag. Supports proxy if specified

generate-platform-service-varfile.help: Generates a file with variables for the specified platform service, or fills it with missing parameters if the file already exists

variables-file.help: The path to a file with variables. The path is the current working directory by default with the filename '<service>.varfile.json'

activate-platform-service.help: Activates a platform service for your tenant

interactive-mode.help: A flag. If specified the service-specific parameters will be asked interactively

variables-file.help: The path to a file with variables for activation of a platform service

destroy-after.help: The number of hours after service will be expired automatically

deactivate-platform-service.help: Deactivates a platform service running for your tenant

service-id.help: The ID of the service to be deactivated

describe-platform-service-stacks.help: List of the platform service stacks activated for a tenant

all.help: A flag. If specified, the services activated in all tenants of the current customer are displayed

describe-platform-services.help: Provides details about the configuration of platform service available in a tenant

tenant.help: Displaying the list of the available platform services in the tenant

template-type.help: The template type. Allowed values: [CLOUD_FORMATION, TERRAFORM]. If specified, displays services by template type

service.help: The service name. Required if --tenant and --cloud are not specified

run-instances.help: Creates instances of the specified configuration

cloud.help:
The cloud. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE, VMWARE, YANDEX]

region.help: The region name

image.help: The name of the image that will be used to the instance configuration

shape.help: Required in case of InstanceType not specified. Instance shape is a Maestro name of mapped to InstanceType and corresponding attributes in other CPs. Some possible values: LARGE, MICRO, SMALL, etc

instance-type.help: Required in case of Shape not specified. Instance type is a native attribute of instance used to determine the types and amount of hardware resources available to the instance

key-name.help: The SSH key name of the key pair. Optional for Azure cloud

number-of-instances.help: Number of the instances that will be run. If parameter is not specified, default value will be equal to 1

stop-after.help: Expiration parameter which specifies when the machine will stop

terminate-after.help: Termination parameter which specifies when the machine will terminate

additional-storage.help: The size of an additional storage storage in GB

script.help: The name of the script that will be applied

validation.regex_error: Script names should consist of characters from 'a-z', '0-9', '-_', and be 6-32 characters in length, including a valid extension such as '.sh', '.bat', '.cmd', or '.ps1'

tag.help: Tags. Pass several values in the following format: key1:val1,key2:val2,key3:val3

instance-id.help: The IDs of the instances. For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

backup.help: Provides assistance with using the Backup Platform Service for data backup and recovery

instance-id.help:
The IDs of the instances. 
For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

backup-server-id.help: The ID of the backup server

instance-id.help: The IDs of the instances. For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

describe-storages.help: Describes instance storages existing in the specific tenant

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance. Use to see the storages of the specified instance

storage-id.help:
Storage IDs. Use to see the descriptions of the specific storages 
For several storages, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

create-attach-storage.help: Creates the storage and attaches to the specified instance

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance to which the storage will be added

size.help: The maximum size of a storage at creation, in GB

detach-storage.help: Detaches the specified storage from instance

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance from which the storage will be detached

decrypt-password.help: Decrypts the password for windows instances

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance for which the password should be decrypted

private-key-path.help: The path to the file with the private key part

describe-schedules.help: Describes the schedules set to instances in your tenant

region.help: The region name

schedule-type.help: The schedule type. Allowed values: [Specified instances, My instances with tag, All my instances in region]

create-schedule.help: Creates a new schedule for automatic instance state management

name.help: The display name of the schedule

cron.help: The cron rule that will be used by the schedule. It should contain these parameters separated by spaces, in given order: seconds (optional), minutes, hours, days of month, months, days of weeks, year (optional). Example: s m d M d/w y. Accepted placeholders: * (all values), ? (no specific value), / (increments), - (range)

action.help: The action for the schedule. Allowed values: [START, STOP]

schedule-type.help: The schedule type. Allowed values: [Specified instances, My instances with tag, All my instances in region]

instance-id.help:
The IDs of the instances. 
For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

tag-key.help:
The key of the tag of the instance to which the schedule is to be applied. 
Required for schedule type "My instances with tag"

tag-value.help:
The value of the tag of the instance to which the schedule is to be applied. 
Required for schedule type "My instances with tag"

delete-schedule.help: Deletes a schedule from your tenants schedule library

name.help: The name of the schedule used for reference

total-report.help: Gets a total billing report for a tenant

from.help: Start date. Format (dd.mm.yyyy). Use with 'to' for a custom range

to.help: End date. Format (dd.mm.yyyy). Use with 'from' for a custom range

tag.help: Collects only records with a specified tag. Use the following format: tag=value

report.help: A flag. If specified the report will be sent by email

cloud.help:
The list of the cloud names. Should be specified if you need 
Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

year.help: Year. Format (yyyy). Use with 'month' for a 1-month range, or with 'month' and 'day' for a 1-day range

month.help: Month. Format (mm). Use with 'year' for a 1-month range, or with 'day' for a 1-day range

day.help: Day. Format (dd). Use with 'year' and 'month' for a 1-day range

adjustment.help: A flag. If specified, only adjustments will be shown

url.help: A flag. If specified, the presigned URL will be generated

Filter by criteria. 
Allowed values: [ALL(default), DEPLETED, ACTUAL, DISABLED]

region.help: The region name for the AWS cloud provider

resource-type.help:
The type of the resource. Allowed values: "HIGH_UTILIZED_WORKSPACES", "IDLE_ELBS", "IDLE_NAT_GATEWAYS", "IDLE_VPC_ENDPOINTS",
"LOW_UTILIZED_ELBS", "LOW_UTILIZED_NAT_GATEWAYS", "LOW_UTILIZED_VPNS", "EBS_VOLUMES_MODERNIZE_GP2_TO_GP3", "EBS_SNAPSHOT_TRENDS", "S3_BUCKET_TRENDS_AND_OPTIMIZATIONS"

to.help: End date. Format (dd.mm.yyyy). Use with 'from' for a custom range

tag.help: Collects only records with a specified tag. Use the following format: tag=value

The region name. Specify this parameter to filter report records by region.
Can not be provided with "--cloud" parameter

The list of the cloud names. Can not be provided with "--region" parameter.

The IDs of the instances by which a report will be generated.
For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

tag.help: Collects only records with a specified tag. Use the following format: tag=value

region.help: The region name.  Specify this parameter to filter report records by region

report.help: A flag. If specified the report will be sent by email

product.help: The product name. If not specified, 'All' will be used

usage-type.help: The usage type. If not specified, 'All' will be used

resource-type.help: The resource type. If not specified, 'All' will be used

hourly-report.help: Gets hourly billing report for the specified tenant

date.help: Date. Format (dd.mm.yyyy). Or specify 'year, month and day' instead

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

url.help: A flag. If specified, the presigned URL will be generated

access-type.help: The type of the access to be provided. Allowed values: [IAM_USER, ASSUME_ROLE, FEDERATED_USER, CLOUD_ADMIN_USER]

upload-script.help: Uploads the user script to the specific tenant in Maestro

source-path.help: The path to the script file. The file extension should be either '.sh', '.bat', 'cmd' or '.ps1'

script.help: The name of the script to be uploaded. The file extension(.sh, .cmd, ...) will be taken from 'spath'

validation.regex_error: Script name must be 6-32 characters long and can include only these characters in lower case: 'a-z', '0-9', -_

delete-scripts.help: Deletes the user script from the specific tenant in Maestro

script.help: List of the name of the file to be deleted. Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

describe-script.help: Describes the script files uploaded to Maestro and available for the specific tenant

script.help: The file name. If this parameter is specified, the content of the script will be returned

policy-type.help: The pricing policy type. Allowed values: [DEFAULT, PROJECT, PERSONAL]

validation.help: The pricing policy type. Allowed values: [DEFAULT, PROJECT, PERSONAL]

inactive.help: A flag. If specified the price model for inactive resources will be returned

shape.help: A shape name. Can be used to filter instance price model by specified shape

create-image.help: Creates an image based on an existing instance

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

name.help:
The image name.  Length: 3-63. 
Restrictions for Google regions: lowercase alphanumeric characters including hyphens if not on first or last place. 
EPAM, Azure and AWS regions: alphanumeric characters including .()[]-@_

delete-image.help: Deletes an image created from a project instance

image-id.help: The ID of the image to be deleted

delete-key.help: Deletes a SSH key from your account

key-name.help: The SSH key name of the key to be deleted

cloud.help:
The cloud to which the key is applied. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK]

key-name.help: The SSH key name of the keypair to be described

region.help: The name of the region where the key is applied

import-key.help: Imports public part of SSH keys for a specific cloud, region and tenant to Maestro

key-name.help:
The SSH key name of the new key. 
SSH key names must be 6-32 characters long, and include only these characters - '0-9', 'a-z', 'A-Z', '-_'

file-path.help: The path to the RSA public key file

cloud.help:
The cloud name where the key will be imported.  
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK]

tenant.help: The tenant name where the key will be imported

all-tenants.help: A flag. If specified the key pair for all tenants will be imported

region.help: The region name where the key will be imported

describe-events.help: Lists the events that took place in your virtual infrastructure

event-id.help: Event ID. Use it to see more details about a specific event

search-type.help:
Search type. 
Allowed values: [ALL(default), TENANT, SECURITY, BILLING, MANAGEMENT, AZURE_BICEP, TERRAFORM, CLOUD_FORMATION, VIOLATION]

cloud.help:
The cloud. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, ENTERPRISE, GOOGLE, HARDWARE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE]

region.help: The region name

resource-id.help: The ID of the resource for which the events should be retrieved. Required in case the RELATED search-type is specified

number-of-events.help:
The number of events to be displayed. 
Allowed values: 1-100. The default value: 10

upload-terraform-template-from-git.help: Uploads a Terraform template from Git

template.help: The name of the template that will be uploaded

validation.regex_error: The length of template name should be between 2 and 128 symbols. The following characters are allowed in template names: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, !, -, _, ., *, ', (, )

git-url.help: URL of the Git project with the template

token.help: The personal access token to access the Git project

branch.help: The name of a Git branch

folder.help: The path to the Terraform template in the Git project

webhook.help: The Terraform action executed after receiving the push-webhook. Allowed values: [NONE, AUTO_PLAN, AUTO_APPLY]

provider-type.help: The Git service provider. Allowed values: [GITHUB, GITLAB]

terraform-version.help: The version of Terraform used in the template should be indicated with the letter 'v'. For example v0.14.9

validation.regex_error: The length of the Terraform template version should be between 2 and 17 symbols and consist of no more than 4 groups separated by (.) The following characters are required in the template version name: v, ., 0-9. Example: v0.14.9

description.help: The description for the Terraform template

multistack.help: Flag. If specified the template can be used to create multiple stacks

approver.help: Template Approvers. For several template approvers, please specify each approver's email individually, separated by a comma without a space. For example: email1,email2

approval-policy.help: The approval rule. Allowed values: [ALL, ONE]

variables-file.help: Specify the path to the JSON file that contains the variables. Supported types: STRING, MAP, LIST, BOOL, NUMBER

variables.help:
Provide the variables along with their values. The format should be:
"key1:value1" for strings, "key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\"" for lists and "key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\"" for objects.
Simultaneous use is possible: "key1:value1,key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\",key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\""
Note: the example uses cmd syntax. If you use bash or powershell, update the parameter value specification accordingly

template.help:
Names of templates. 
Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

stack-id.help: The list of stack identifiers. For several stacks, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., st00000001,st00000002)

instance-id.help: The IDs of the instances. For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)
The IDs of the instances. For several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

template.help: The name of the template to be deleted

Provide the variables along with their values. The format should be:
"key1:value1" for strings, "key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\"" for lists and "key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\"" for objects.
Simultaneous use is possible: "key1:value1,key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\",key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\""
Note: the example uses cmd syntax. If you use bash or powershell, update the parameter value specification accordingly

variables-file.help: Specify the path to the JSON file that contains the variables. Supported types: STRING, MAP, LIST, BOOL, NUMBER

Provide the variables along with their values. The format should be:
"key1:value1" for strings, "key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\"" for lists and "key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\"" for objects.
Simultaneous use is possible: "key1:value1,key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\",key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\""

lock-terraform-template.help: Lock a Terraform template to prevent any actions from other users

template.help: The name of the Terraform template that is to be locked

expiration.help: Expiration parameter which specifies time in hours. You can specify the lock time within the range of 1-168 hours

prolong-terraform-template-lock.help: Prolong a Terraform template lock to prevent any actions from other users

template.help: The name of the Terraform template for which the lock is to be prolonged

expiration.help: Expiration parameter which specifies time in hours. You can prolong the locking time in the range of 1-168 hours

unlock-terraform-template.help: Unlock a Terraform template to allow actions from other users

template.help: The name of the Terraform template that needs to be unlocked

destroy-terraform-stack.help: Destroys resources related to a Terraform template or stack

template.help: The name of the template to be destroyed

stack-id.help: The ID of the stack which resources will be destroyed

create-instance-quota.help: Sets up a number of instances allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

creation-interval-hours.help: The period in hours during which the specified amount of instances can be created

instance-amount.help: The number of instances one can create during creation interval

describe-instance-quota.help: Describes the limitation for the number of instances allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

delete-instance-quota.help: Deletes the limitation for the number of instances allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

create-storage-quota.help: Sets up an amount and size of storages allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

storage-max-size.help: The maximum size of a storage at creation, in GB

creation-interval-hours.help: The period in hours during which the specified amount of storages can be created

storage-amount.help: The number of storages one can create during creation interval

describe-storage-quota.help: Describes the limitation for the number and size of storages allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

delete-storage-quota.help: Deletes the limitations for an amount and size of storages allowed for creation on a specific tenant within a specific interval

create-key.help: Creates a SSH key used to access instances without need to provide login credentials

key-name.help:
The SSH key name of the new key. 
SSH key names must be 6-32 characters long, and include only these characters - '0-9', 'a-z', 'A-Z', '-_'

cloud.help:
The cloud name where the key will be applied. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK]

tenant.help: The tenant name where the key will be applied

all-tenants.help: A flag. If specified the key pair for all tenants will be created

region.help: The region name where the key will be applied

save-to-path.help: The path to the directory where the new SSH keys will be saved

manage-key.help: Manage your SSH keys. Adds or deletes an SSH key in a region

action.help: An action to be done with a keypair. Allowed values: [ADD, REMOVE]

cloud.help: The cloud. Allowed_values: [AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK]

region.help: The region name. Required if the all-region parameter is not specified. For several regions, specify the regions one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., value1,value2)

all-regions.help: A flag. If specified, the key will be updated in all regions of the cloud provider

describe-tenants.help: Describes the tenants available for the user

inactive.help: A flag. If specified only the inactive tenants will be displayed

hidden.help: A flag. If specified the hidden regions will be displayed

cloud.help:
The cloud. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, ENTERPRISE, GOOGLE, HARDWARE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE, HYPERV, VMWARE, WORKSPACE]

tenant.help: A list of tenants. Pass several values in the following format: value1,value2,value3

all.help: A flag. If specified active and inactive tenants including hidden regions will be displayed

describe-regions.help: Describes the regions available for a tenant in the specified cloud

inactive.help: A flag. If specified, the inactive regions are shown

include-hidden.help: A flag. If specified, the hidden regions are shown

cloud.help:
The cloud. 
Allowed values: [AWS, AZURE, ENTERPRISE, GOOGLE, HARDWARE, NUTANIX, OPEN_STACK, VSPHERE]

describe-shapes.help: Describes the shapes available for your tenant

native-shapes.help: Flag. If specified, shows cloud-native instance types instead of Maestro3 standardized shapes

add-schedule-instances.help: Adds an existing schedule to one or several  instances

instance-id.help:
The IDs of the instances. 
To set the schedule for several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

delete-schedule-instances.help: Deletes a schedule from one or several  instances

instance-id.help:
The IDs of the instances. 
To delete the schedule from several instances, specify the IDs one by one, separated by a comma without space (e.g., vmo00000001,vmo00000002)

delete-tags.help: Deletes tags. Applicable both for public and private clouds

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

tag-key.help: Tag-keys. Pass several keys of tags in the following format: key1,key2,key3

describe-tags.help: Describes instance tags. Applicable both for public and private clouds

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

set-tags.help: Sets tag for the instance. Applicable both for public and private clouds

overwrite.help: Flag. If specified, the existing tags will be replaced with the passed

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance

tag.help: Tags. Pass several values in the following format: key1:val1,key2:val2,key3:val3

storage-id.help: Storage IDs. Pass several values in the following format: storage1,storage2,storage3

file-path.help: Path to the file that will be used as a source of the template

terraform-version.help: The version of Terraform to use. The version of template should be indicated with the letter 'v'. For example v0.14.9

validation.regex_error: The length of the Terraform template version should be between 2 and 17 symbols and consist of no more than 4 groups separated by (.) The following characters are required in the template version name: v, ., 0-9. Example: v0.14.9

template.help: The name of the template that will be uploaded

validation.regex_error: The length of template name should be between 2 and 128 symbols. The following characters are allowed in template names: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, !, -, _, ., *, ', (, )

description.help: The description for the Terraform template. Describe the purpose of your template or provide other relevant information

multistack.help: A flag. If specified the template can be used to create multiple stacks

approver.help: Template Approvers. For several template approvers, please specify each approver's email individually, separated by a comma without a space. For example: email1,email2

approval-policy.help:
The approval rule. Allowed values: [ALL, ONE]. If specified, template will be send to request the technical approval of your Terraform template from other persons  
ALL: All approvals required 
ONE: At least one approval required

variables-file.help: Specify the path to the JSON file that contains the variables. Supported types: STRING, MAP, LIST, BOOL, NUMBER

variables.help:
Provide the variables along with their values. The format should be:
"key1:value1" for strings, "key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\"" for lists and "key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\"" for objects.
Simultaneous use is possible: "key1:value1,key2:\"value2_1,value2_2\",key3:\"key3_1=value3_1,key3_2=value3_2\""
Note: the example uses cmd syntax. If you use bash or powershell, update the parameter value specification accordingly

export-terraform-template.help: Exports a Terraform template as a signed URL

template.help: The name of the template to be exported

tag.help: Collect only records with specified tag. Use the following format: tag=value

account-id.help: The account-id parameter may be specified only in case ACCOUNT report-type is set. account-id is not applicable with other values of report-type

report-type.help: The type of the report. Allowed values: [ACCOUNT, ACTIVE, ADJUSTMENT, ALL_PERSONAL, ANNUAL, CUSTOMERS, INACTIVE, NOT_PMC, UNITS, UPSA_INACTIVE, NATIVE]

region.help: The cloud providers or the region or the report family. Allowed values: [HARDWARE, AWS, AWS_UNREACHABLE, AZURE, AZURE_NATIVE, GOOGLE, MOBILE, ENTERPRISE, SWIFT_STACK, REPORT_PORTAL, WORKSPACES, AWS_WORKSPACES, AZURE_WORKSPACES, AWS_PAAS, AWS_ATLAS, AZURE_PAAS, GOOGLE_PAAS, PRIVATE_PAAS, PRIVATE]

include-billing-source.help: A flag. Include billing source for public cloud providers

describe-user-permissions.help: Describes the permission groups assigned to you in the specified tenant

group-name.help: The name of the permission group

environment.help:
The Maestro environment or the third-party application for which to describe your permissions.
Allowed values: [M3_UI, M3_SDK, AWS_CONSOLE, GOOGLE_CONSOLE, AZURE_CONSOLE]

allocate-ip.help: Allocate static IP on specified region in tenant

network.help: The id of the target network

release-ip.help: Release static IP on specified region in tenant

describe-ip.help: Describe static IPs on specified region in tenant

describe-vlans.help: Describe available VLANs on specified region in tenant

deactivate-vlan.help: Deactivate specified VLAN on specified region in tenant

activate-vlan.help: Activate specified VLAN on specified region in tenant

instance-id.help: Target instance id
Target instance ID

disassociate-ip.help: Disassociate static IP from the instance

report.help: This command is a single point of entry for report-related commands: 'total-report', 'subtotal-report', 'resource-report', 'budgets-report' and 'hourly-report'

year.help: Year. Format (yyyy). Use with 'month' for a 1-month range, or with 'month' and 'day' for a 1-day range

month.help: Month. Format (mm). Use with 'year' for a 1-month range, or with 'day' for a 1-day range

day.help: Day. Format (dd). Use with 'year' and 'month' for a 1-day range

type.help: Report type. Possible parameter values: [total, subtotal, resource, hourly, budgets]. Default: total ('total-report' command)

region.help: The region name. Specify this parameter to filter report records by region

tag.help: Collects only records with a specified tag. Use the following format: tag=value

report.help: A flag. If specified the report will be sent by email

url.help: A flag. If specified, the presigned URL will be generated (used for the type: 'total', 'subtotal', 'resource' and 'hourly')

instance-id.help: The ID of the instance (used for the type: 'resource', 'hourly')

adjustment.help: A flag. If specified, only adjustments will be shown (used for the type: 'total', 'subtotal')

create-recommendation-settings.help: Create recommendation settings for cost optimization

cloud.help: Cloud provider. Allowed values: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE

disabled-until.help: Date until which recommendations are disabled. Format: dd.mm.yyyy

type.help: Recommendation filter type (required when using -SRE flag). Pass several values in the following format: TAG_FILTER, RESOURCE, NRID

region.help: Region name (required for -R flag and -SRE with --type RESOURCE)

resource-type.help: Resource type (required for -R flag and -SRE with --type RESOURCE). Allowed value: INSTANCE

resource-id.help: Resource identifier (required for -R flag and -SRE with --type RESOURCE)

native-resource-id.help: Native resource identifier (ARN for AWS, Resource ID for Azure, or Project ID for GCP. Required for -SRE with --type NRID)

category.help: Recommendation categories (required for -R flag). Pass several values in the following format: SCHEDULES,SHUT_DOWN,SCALING,SHAPE,SPLITTING

tag.help: Tags (required for -SRE with --type TAG_FILTER). Pass several values in the following format: key1:val1,key2:val2

update-recommendation-settings.help: Update recommendation settings for cost optimization

cloud.help: Cloud provider. Allowed values: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE

disabled-until.help: Date until which recommendations are disabled. Format: dd.mm.yyyy

type-to-id.help: Mapping of recommendation filter types to their IDs (required when using -SRE flag). Pass several values in the following format: TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2. Types: TAG_FILTER, RESOURCE, NRID

region.help: Region name (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

resource-type.help: Resource type (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type). Allowed value: INSTANCE

resource-id.help: Resource identifier (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

native-resource-id.help: Native resource identifier (ARN for AWS, Resource ID for Azure, or Project ID for GCP. Required for -SRE flag with --type-to-id NRID:<id>)

category.help: Recommendation categories (required for -R flag). Pass several values in the following format: SCHEDULES,SHUT_DOWN,SCALING,SHAPE,SPLITTING

tag.help: Tags (required for -SRE flag with TAG_FILTER type). Pass several values in the following format: key1:val1,key2:val2

describe-recommendation-settings.help: Describe recommendation settings for cost optimization

cloud.help: Cloud provider. Allowed values: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE

region.help: Region name (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

resource-type.help: Resource type (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type). Allowed value: INSTANCE

resource-id.help: Resource identifier (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

category.help: Recommendation categories (required for -R flag). Pass several values in the following format: SCHEDULES,SHUT_DOWN,SCALING,SHAPE,SPLITTING

type.help: Recommendation filter type (required when using -SRE flag). Pass several values in the following format: TAG_FILTER, RESOURCE, NRID (NRID: ARN for AWS, Resource ID for Azure, or Project ID for GCP)

remove-recommendation-settings.help: Remove recommendation settings for cost optimization

cloud.help: Cloud provider. Allowed values: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE

type-to-id.help: Mapping of recommendation filter types to their IDs (required when using -SRE flag). Pass several values in the following format: TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2. Types: TAG_FILTER, RESOURCE, NRID

region.help: Region name (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

resource-type.help: Resource type (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type). Allowed value: INSTANCE

resource-id.help: Resource identifier (required for -R flag and -SRE flag with RESOURCE type)

category.help: Recommendation categories (required for -R flag). Pass several values in the following format: SCHEDULES,SHUT_DOWN,SCALING,SHAPE,SPLITTING
